intro: Clermontia tuberculata, commonly known as the Kona hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers with yellow centers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as rainforests and is often found in the Kona District of Hawaii. It has palmate leaves with three to five lobes and produces showy bracteate inflorescences. Clermontia tuberculata is considered an endangered species due to habitat loss and invasive species.
